intro: Thesium passerinoides, commonly known as the sandstone thesium, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Australia. It is a small, herbaceous plant that typically grows in sandy or rocky soils. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in dense, spike-like clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. Its leaves are narrow and linear, adapted to reduce water loss in its harsh environment. Thesium passerinoides is part of the family Xanthorrhoeaceae, which includes other plants with similar ecological adaptations.
